TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in the town of GPE . He is handicapped suffering from a double above - knee amputation .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant acquired State commodity bonds for purchase of a NORP - made ORG passenger car .

CARDINAL . After the ORG had failed to exchange his bonds for a car , in DATE the applicant brought a civil action against ORG of GPE . On DATE ORG of GPE ordered ORG to pay the applicant MONEY ( RUR ) .
CARDINAL . NORP In DATE a writ of execution was submitted to ORG for a further transfer to the local bailiff office which was competent to enforce the judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG requested the applicant to submit details of his bank account .

CARDINAL . In reply to the applicant 's complaint about non - enforcement , on DATE ORG of ORG told him that he could collect the award from ORG . On DATE ORG informed the applicant that all questions relating to the enforcement of the judgment in his favour had to be addressed to the bailiff service .
CARDINAL . It appears that the applicant wrote to ORG in DATE , and in DATE . He also unsuccessfully sought supervisory review of the judgment of QUANTITY DATE .
CARDINAL . According to the Government , on DATE a certain PERSON , pretending to act on the applicant 's behalf , received the award under the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the monies due to the applicant were transferred into his bank account .
